alert.note: Alert for Polk; San Jacinto (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 1:16AM CST until January 25 at 9:30AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Long King Creek near Livingston affecting Polk and San Jacinto Counties. For the Long King Creek...including Livingston...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Long King Creek near Livingston. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, minor lowland flooding begins as water escapes the main channel of the creek. At 25.0 feet, moderate lowland flooding begins as low lying areas along the creek become inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 24.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.2 feet on 12/26/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Long King Creek Livingston 19.0 18.0 Wed 12 am CS 16.5 5.6 4.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM CST.
